data.chText: （对犯罪嫌疑人或可能发生犯罪的地方的）监视
data.enText: the act of carefully watching a person suspected of a crime or a place where a crime may be committed

data.chText: 警方正对嫌疑人实施不间断监视。
data.enText: The police are keeping the suspects under constant surveillance .

means: (对犯罪嫌疑人或可能发生犯罪的地方的)监视

tr: close observation of a person or group (usually by the police)

value.def: Surveillance is the careful watching of someone, especially by an organization such as the police or the army.

example.ex: He was arrested after being kept under constant surveillance...
example.tran: 在被连续监视了一段时间后，他被逮捕了。

example.ex: Police swooped on the home after a two-week surveillance operation...
example.tran: 在两周的监视行动之后，警方突击搜查了那栋房子。

example.ex: Police keep track of the kidnapper using electronic surveillance equipment.
example.tran: 警方利用电子监视设备跟踪绑架者。

value.tran: (尤指来自警方、军队等组织的)监视，监察
